## Methods
The State of the Ecosystem report has examined the presence of Mid-Atlantic managed species in New England and vice versa.  In 2020, this was extended to species managed by the South Atlantic Management Council in the Mid-Atlantic and New England regions.  The vast majority of "southern" managed species do not occur in the NEFSC Bottom Trawl Survey and when they do, they are present in the fall only.  The most common "southern" species was the blue runner (*Caranx crysos*), who's range does include the entire survey area.

### Data sources
The [Survdat](#survdat) data set was used to examine the presence of "southern" species.

### Data extraction
